title: Clearinghouse API Routes
description:
Create REST API Routes for Clearinghouse Submission and Status Queries

Implement API endpoints to submit claims/transactions to a clearinghouse and retrieve submission status.

Technical Implementation:
- Framework: Express.js/FastAPI/Spring Boot (depending on stack)
- Endpoints:
  - POST /api/clearinghouse/submissions - Submit new claim/transaction
  - GET /api/clearinghouse/submissions/:id - Retrieve submission status
  - GET /api/clearinghouse/submissions - List submissions with filtering
  - POST /api/clearinghouse/submissions/:id/retry - Retry failed submission

Data Model:
- ClearinghouseSubmission schema with fields:
  - submissionId (UUID)
  - claimData (JSON/BLOB)
  - status (enum: pending, processing, accepted, rejected, failed)
  - submittedAt, updatedAt timestamps
  - clearinghouseResponse (JSON)
  - retryCount, errorMessage

Integration Layer:
- ClearinghouseClient service for external API communication
- Request/response transformation middleware
- Webhook handler for asynchronous status updates (POST /api/clearinghouse/webhooks)

Validation & Security:
- Request schema validation (Joi/Pydantic/Bean Validation)
- API key authentication for clearinghouse callbacks
- Rate limiting on submission endpoint (e.g., 100 req/min)
- Audit logging for all submission attempts

Error Handling:
- Exponential backoff retry mechanism for transient failures
- Dead letter queue for permanently failed submissions
- Detailed error responses with clearinghouse-specific error codes

Observability:
- Structured logging with correlation IDs
- Metrics: submission success rate, average processing time, retry counts
- Alerts for failed submissions exceeding threshold
